section.heading: Annual modal research plans

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.chapeau: Not later than June 1 of each year, the head of each modal administration and joint program office of the Department of Transportation shall prepare and submit to the Assistant Secretary for Research and Technology of the Department of Transportation (referred to in this chapter as the “Assistant Secretary”)—

subparagraph.content: a comprehensive annual modal research plan for the following fiscal year; and
a detailed outlook for the fiscal year thereafter.

paragraph.heading: Requirements.—
paragraph.chapeau: Each plan under paragraph (1) shall include—

subparagraph.content: a general description of the strategic goals of the Department that are addressed by the research programs being carried out by the Assistant Secretary or modal administration, as applicable;

subparagraph.chapeau: a description of each proposed research program, as described in the budget request submitted by the Secretary of Transportation to the President under section 1108 of title 31 for the following fiscal year, including—

clause.content: the major objectives of the program; and
the requested amount of funding for each program and area;

subparagraph.content: a list of activities the Assistant Secretary or modal administration plans to carry out under the research programs described in subparagraph (B);

subparagraph.chapeau: an assessment of the potential impact of the research programs described in subparagraph (B), including—

clause.content: potential outputs, outcomes, and impacts on technologies and practices used by entities subject to the jurisdiction of the modal administration;
potential effects on applicable regulations of the modal administration, including the modification or modernization of those regulations;
potential economic or societal impacts; and

clause.chapeau: progress made toward achieving strategic goals of—

subparagraph.chapeau: a description of potential partnerships to be established to conduct the research program, including partnerships with—

subparagraph.content: such other requirements as the Assistant Secretary considers to be necessary.

paragraph.heading: Relationship to strategic plan.—
paragraph.content: Each plan prepared or submitted under paragraph (1), after the plan required in 2016, shall be consistent with the strategic plan developed under section 6503.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.chapeau: Not later than September 1 of each year, the Assistant Secretary, for each plan and outlook submitted by the head of a modal administration or joint program office pursuant to subsection (a), shall—

subparagraph.content: review the scope of the research; and

clause.content: approve the plan and outlook; or

clause.chapeau: request that the plan and outlook be—

subclause.content: revised in accordance with such suggestions as the Assistant Secretary shall include to ensure conformity with the criteria described in paragraph (2); and
resubmitted to the Assistant Secretary for approval.

paragraph.heading: Criteria.—
paragraph.chapeau: In conducting a review under paragraph (1)(A), the Assistant Secretary shall, with respect to the modal research plan that is the subject of the review—

clause.content: the plan contains research objectives that are consistent with the strategic research and policy objectives of the Department of Transportation included in the strategic plan required under section 6503; and
the research programs described in the plan have the potential to benefit the safety, mobility, and efficiency of the United States transportation system;

subparagraph.content: identify and evaluate any potential opportunities for collaboration between or among modal administrations with respect to particular research programs described in the plan;
identify and evaluate whether other modal administrations may be better suited to carry out the research programs described in the plan;

subparagraph.chapeau: assess whether any projects described in the plan are—

subparagraph.content: take into consideration such other criteria as the Assistant Secretary determines to be necessary.

paragraph.heading: Publications.—
paragraph.content: Not later than January 30 of each year, the Secretary shall publish on a public website each plan and outlook that has been approved under paragraph (1)(B)(i).

paragraph.heading: Rejection of duplicative research efforts.—
paragraph.content: The Assistant Secretary may not approve any plan submitted by the head of a modal administration or joint program office pursuant to subsection (a) if any of the projects described in the plan duplicate significant aspects of research efforts of any other modal administration.

paragraph.heading: Savings clause.—
paragraph.content: Nothing in this subsection limits the ability of the head of a modal administration to comply with applicable law.

subsection.heading: Funding Limitations.—
subsection.chapeau: No funds may be expended by the Department of Transportation on research that has been determined by the Assistant Secretary under subsection (b)(4) to be duplicative unless—

paragraph.content: the research is required by an Act of Congress;
the research was part of a contract that was funded before the date of enactment of this chapter;
the research updates previously commissioned research; or
the Assistant Secretary certifies to Congress that such research is necessary, and provides justification for such certification.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.chapeau: The Secretary shall annually certify to Congress that—

subparagraph.content: each modal research plan has been reviewed; and
there is no duplication of study for research directed, commissioned, or conducted by the Department of Transportation.

paragraph.heading: Corrective action plan.—
paragraph.chapeau: If the Secretary, after submitting a certification under paragraph (1), identifies duplication of research within the Department of Transportation, the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.content: notify Congress of the duplicative research; and
submit to Congress a corrective action plan to eliminate the duplicative research.

section.heading: Consolidated research database

paragraph.heading: Submission.—
paragraph.chapeau: Not later than September 1 of each year, the head of each modal administration and joint program office of the Department of Transportation shall submit to the Assistant Secretary, for review and public posting, a description of each proposed research project to be carried out during the following fiscal year, including—

subparagraph.content: proposed funding for any new projects; and
proposed additional funding for any existing projects.

paragraph.heading: Publication.—
paragraph.content: Not less frequently than annually, after receiving the descriptions under paragraph (1), the Assistant Secretary shall publish on a public website a comprehensive database including a description of all research projects conducted by the Department of Transportation, including research funded through university transportation centers under section 5505.

paragraph.heading: Contents.—
paragraph.chapeau: The database published under paragraph (2) shall—

subparagraph.content: be delimited by research project; and

subparagraph.chapeau: include a description of, with respect to each research project—

clause.content: the progress made with respect to the project, including whether the project is ongoing or complete;
any outcomes of the project, including potential implications for policy, regulations, or guidance issued by a modal administration or the Department of Transportation;
the amount of funds allocated for the project; and
such other information as the Assistant Secretary determines to be necessary to address Departmental priorities and statutory mandates;

subparagraph.content: identify research projects with multimodal applications;
specify how relevant modal administrations have assisted, will contribute to, or plan to use the findings from the research projects identified under paragraph (1);
identify areas in which more than 1 modal administration is conducting research on a similar subject or a subject that has a bearing on more than 1 mode;
indicate how the findings of research are being disseminated to improve the efficiency, effectiveness, and safety of transportation systems; and
describe the public and stakeholder input to the research plans submitted under section 6501(a)(1).

subsection.heading: Funding Report.—
subsection.chapeau: In conjunction with each of the annual budget requests submitted by the President under section 1105 of title 31, the Secretary shall annually publish on a public website and submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report that describes—

paragraph.content: the amount spent in the last full fiscal year on transportation research and development with specific descriptions of projects funded at $5,000,000 or more; and
the amount proposed in the current budget for transportation research and development with specific descriptions of projects funded at $5,000,000 or more.

subsection.heading: Performance Plans and Reports.—
subsection.chapeau: In the plans and reports submitted under sections 1115 and 1116 of title 31, the Secretary shall include—

paragraph.content: a summary of the Federal transportation research and development activities for the previous fiscal year in each topic area;
the amount spent in each topic area;
a description of the extent to which the research and development is meeting the expectations described in section 6503(c)(1); and
any amendments to the strategic plan developed under section 6503.

section.heading: Transportation research and development 5-year strategic plan

subsection.heading: In General.—
subsection.content: Not later than 180 days after the date of publication of the Department of Transportation Strategic Plan and not less frequently than once every 5 years thereafter, the Secretary shall develop a 5-year transportation research and development strategic plan to guide future Federal transportation research and development activities.

subsection.heading: Consistency.—
subsection.chapeau: Each strategic plan developed under subsection (a) shall be consistent with—

paragraph.content: section 306 of title 5;
sections 1115 and 1116 of title 31; and
any other research and development plan within the Department of Transportation.

subsection.heading: Contents.—
subsection.chapeau: Each strategic plandeveloped under subsection (a) shall—

paragraph.chapeau: describe how the plan furthers the primary purposes of the transportation research and development program, which shall include—

subparagraph.content: improving mobility of people and goods;
reducing congestion;
promoting safety;
improving the durability and extending the life of transportation infrastructure;
preserving the environment;
preserving the existing transportation system; and
reducing transportation cybersecurity risks;

paragraph.chapeau: for each of the purposes referred to in paragraph (1), list the primary proposed research and development activities that the Department of Transportation intends to pursue to accomplish that purpose, which may include—

subparagraph.content: fundamental research pertaining to the applied physical and natural sciences;
applied science and research;
technology development research; and
social science research; and

paragraph.chapeau: for each research and development activity—

subparagraph.content: identify the anticipated annual funding levels for the period covered by the strategic plan; and
describe the research findings the Department expects to discover at the end of the period covered by the strategic plan.

subsection.heading: Considerations.—
subsection.chapeau: The Secretary shall ensure that each strategic plan developed under this section—

paragraph.content: reflects input from a wide range of external stakeholders;

includes and integrates the research and development programs of all of the modal administrations of the Department of Transportation, including aviation, transit, rail, and maritime and joint programs;
takes into account research and development by other Federal, State, local, private sector, and nonprofit institutions;
not later than December 31, 2021, and not less frequently than once every 5 years thereafter, is published on a public website; and

paragraph.chapeau: takes into account how research and development by other Federal, State, private sector, and nonprofit institutions—

subparagraph.content: contributes to the achievement of the purposes identified under subsection (c)(1); and
avoids unnecessary duplication of those efforts.

section.heading: Incorporation of Department of Transportation research

subsection.heading: Review.—
subsection.chapeau: Not later than December 31, 2021, and not less frequently than once every 5 years thereafter, in concurrence with the applicable strategic plan under section 6503, the Secretary of Transportation shall—

paragraph.content: conduct a review of research conducted by the Department of Transportation; and

to the maximum extent practicable and appropriate, identify modifications to laws, regulations, guidance, and other policy documents to incorporate any innovations resulting from the research described in paragraph (1) that have the potential to improve the safety or efficiency of the United States transportation system.

subsection.heading: Requirements.—
subsection.chapeau: In conducting a review under subsection (a), the Secretary of Transportation shall—

paragraph.content: identify any innovative practices, materials, or technologies that have demonstrable benefits to the transportation system;
determine whether the practices, materials, or technologies described in paragraph (1) require any statutory or regulatory modifications for adoption; and

subparagraph.chapeau: if modifications are determined to be required under paragraph (2), develop—

clause.content: a proposal for those modifications; and

clause.chapeau: a description of the manner in which any such regulatory modifications would be—

subclause.content: incorporated into the Unified Regulatory Agenda; or
adopted into existing regulations as soon as practicable; or

subparagraph.content: if modifications are determined not to be required under paragraph (2), develop a description of the means by which the practices, materials, or technologies described in paragraph (1) will otherwise be incorporated into Department of Transportation or modal administration policy or guidance, including as part of the Technology Transfer Program of the Office of the Assistant Secretary for Research and Technology.

subsection.heading: Report.—
subsection.chapeau: On completion of each review under subsection (a), the Secretary of Transportation shall submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report describing, with respect to the period covered by the report—

paragraph.content: each new practice, material, or technology identified under subsection (b)(1); and

paragraph.chapeau: any statutory or regulatory modification for the adoption of such a practice, material, or technology that—

subparagraph.content: is determined to be required under subsection (b)(2); or
was otherwise made during that period.
